term: MMSE score between 22 and 30
unstructured: Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) score was 24 at screening.

term: Positive amyloid PET scan
unstructured: Amyloid PET imaging revealed elevated amyloid deposition.

term: Clinical Dementia Rating (CDR) score of 0.5 to 1.0
unstructured: CDR score was assessed as 0.5 indicating very mild dementia.

term: Apolipoprotein E (ApoE) genotyping
unstructured: Patient consented to ApoE genetic testing for AD risk.

term: Uncontrolled hypertension
unstructured: Hypertension not managed with medication, BP >170/100.

term: Significant cerebrovascular disease
unstructured: MRI indicates evidence of chronic cerebrovascular ischemia.

term: Stable use of symptomatic AD medications
unstructured: Patient has been on donepezil 10mg for over 3 months.

term: History of stroke or TIA within 1 year
unstructured: Patient had a minor stroke 8 months ago.

term: Study partner available for the duration of the trial
unstructured: Patient's spouse agreed to accompany them to all clinic visits as study partner.

term: History of psychiatric illness (e.g., major depression, psychosis)
unstructured: Patient had a diagnosis of major depressive disorder 6 months ago.

term: Contraindications to MRI (e.g., metal implants, pacemakers)
unstructured: MRI contraindicated due to presence of pacemaker.

term: Evidence of abnormal liver or renal function
unstructured: Elevated liver enzymes noted in baseline labs.

term: History of alcohol or substance abuse in past 1–2 years
unstructured: Patient reports alcohol dependence until last year.

term: Use of investigational drug within past 6 months
unstructured: Subject previously enrolled in trial involving investigational BACE inhibitor.

term: Adequate vision and hearing to complete assessments
unstructured: Hearing and visual acuity adequate for neuropsych testing.

term: Pregnant or breastfeeding
unstructured: Pregnancy test positive at baseline screening.

term: Age between 50 and 90 years
unstructured: Patient is 72 years old at time of screening.

term: Diagnosis of probable Alzheimer's Disease or MCI due to AD
unstructured: Clinical diagnosis of mild cognitive impairment due to Alzheimer’s Disease.

term: Abnormal memory function (e.g., WMS-R LM II or equivalent)
unstructured: Logical Memory II recall score was below normal range for age.

term: Participation in another monoclonal antibody therapy trial
unstructured: Previously enrolled in a monoclonal antibody trial targeting amyloid.

term: Stable dose of Alzheimer’s medications for at least 8–12 weeks
unstructured: On donepezil 10mg for past 3 months without dose change.

term: Positive biomarker for brain amyloid pathology (PET/CSF/plasma)
unstructured: CSF Aβ42 levels below threshold consistent with AD pathology.

term: Major systemic illness not under control (cardiac, hepatic, renal)
unstructured: Patient has poorly controlled heart failure with recent hospitalization.

term: Body Mass Index (BMI) between 17 and 35
unstructured: BMI calculated at 26.7 during screening visit.

term: No other neurodegenerative diseases (e.g., Parkinson’s, Huntington’s)
unstructured: History of Parkinson’s disease ruled out at screening.

term: No evidence of intracranial mass or lesions (e.g., glioma, contusion)

term: No history of seizures within past 12 months
unstructured: No seizures reported in last year.

term: No contraindicated medications (e.g., methyldopa, neuroleptics)
unstructured: Patient discontinued neuroleptics 6 weeks before screening.

term: No unstable cardiovascular disease (e.g., angina, CHF)
unstructured: Patient has stable coronary artery disease and no recent angina.

term: Hamilton Depression Rating Scale ≤ 12
unstructured: HAM-D score was 9 at baseline screening.

term: No history of clinically significant head trauma
unstructured: No head trauma events noted in patient history.

term: Normal thyroid function
unstructured: TSH level was 2.0 uIU/mL, within normal range.

term: Informant confirms gradual memory decline over 6–12 months
unstructured: Caregiver reports patient's memory has worsened over the past year.

term: No active infection or systemic illness in past 30 days
unstructured: No fevers, cough, or infections documented in past month.

term: Willing and able to comply with protocol procedures
unstructured: Patient and caregiver agreed to attend all follow-up visits.

term: Consent provided by participant or legal representative
unstructured: Written informed consent obtained from participant’s legal guardian.

term: No vitamin B12 deficiency or clinically significant low levels
unstructured: Vitamin B12 level was 550 pg/mL — within normal range.

term: Stable use of non-AD medications ≥4 weeks prior to baseline
unstructured: Blood pressure meds stable for 6 weeks prior to screening.

term: No recent surgery requiring general anesthesia
unstructured: No major surgery noted in past 3 months.

term: No suicidal ideation or recent psychiatric hospitalization
unstructured: No suicidal thoughts or psychiatric admission in last 6 months.

term: No brain hemorrhage or bleeding disorder
unstructured: MRI showed no signs of intracranial bleeding or hemorrhage.

term: No uncontrolled diabetes mellitus

term: No anticoagulation therapy other than low-dose aspirin
unstructured: Patient on warfarin—excluded due to anticoagulant use.

term: No HIV infection

term: No use of systemic corticosteroids within 3 months

term: No participation in anti-amyloid immunotherapy trials

term: No history of systemic cancer within last 5 years

term: No active suicidal ideation or attempt in past 6 months

term: No hypersensitivity to monoclonal antibody treatments

term: No participation in investigational drug trials within 30 days

term: No G6PD deficiency

term: MRI must be free of significant lesions or abnormalities

term: Absence of severe visual or hearing impairment

term: Age ≥ 50 years
unstructured: Patient is 68 years old—meets age eligibility criteria.

term: No current enrollment in other interventional trials
unstructured: Not participating in any other active investigational study.

term: Willingness to undergo lumbar puncture or PET scan

term: Stable medical condition for at least 3 months

term: No active CNS infection or demyelinating disease
unstructured: No evidence of CNS inflammation or multiple sclerosis.

term: Mini-Mental State Examination (MMSE) 18–26

term: Diagnosis of probable Alzheimer's dementia per NIA-AA

term: Consent provided by patient or legally authorized representative

term: Geriatric Depression Scale (GDS) score ≤ 6

term: Age ≥ 40 years
